name: Econo Lodge Lucky Lane

reviews.title: good hotel for price
reviews.text: This hotel has a nice warm pool, this has to be the cleanest pool I have been in a while. The water was crystal blue and they have a steam room. The breakfast room has new modern atrium style sunroom. I stay at Econolodge across the US and this is by far the best keep it up!

reviews.title: Grossiest hotel ever!
reviews.text: This hotel is gross. It is the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I have serious doubts that the sheets were washed. I would rather sleep in my car than sleep at this place again. Stay near the university - the hotels looked much nicer on that side of town and that's where the restaurants are also.

reviews.title: I'll be back!
reviews.text: The family and I came up to Flagstaff for some snowboarding, and this hotel was a perfect stay for the night. It is a great location, and the rooms must have just been fixed up, it was a great night of needed sleep. Without a doubt, this has to be one of the better hotels I've stayed at in this old town. I'll be back for another stay and thanks for the great accomadation.

reviews.title: Will never, ever stay there again!

reviews.text: - They say they have high speed internet. Well on the 3rd. floor I was lucky to get any internet at all and when I did the signal strength was low! Also when I asked one of the workers about the data ports that are supposed to be in each room, he said he had no idea what I was talking about.
reviews.title: Average service for its price

reviews.text: I made a trip to Flagstaff last year with three boys and we stayed at a nicer place that had a pool and a hot breakfast. They wanted to go again this year, but the place we stayed last year was charging a lot, so I decided this place had an indoor pool and breakfast, and a suite for a low price, maybe it would be okay. We'd be outside most of the time anyway.
reviews.title: Remember this is a budget hotel

likes.liked: — Clean room, no major flaws--a good alternative for anyone needing to cut lodging costs

reviews.text: The upside...it was serviceable for the money. If you need a place that is somewhere to sleep and shower and you need to keep lodging costs low, you may find the low room price a good deal. This is a better place for someone passing through, or like me, making a one night getaway. If you are planning a destination or "big" vacation, you should probably set your sights on something with at least one more star in its rating.
reviews.title: Starving in Flagstaff, Az

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside...don't go expecting for a fraction of the price to get a room that's similar to something costing much more.
reviews.title: Hated it...

reviews.text: I liked: the room (suite they call it) was big, had a freezer (no refrigerator, the appliance froze everything, like it or not) a microwave and coffee. It was not near train tracks, which is a plus in Flagstaff. It was clean enough. It was okay for the money. It had a baclony.
reviews.title: Don't let the new paint job fool you.

reviews.text: I didn't like: the room is advertised as a suite, but is really just a deluxe room. It is slightly bigger than other rooms and has the food prep area (microwave, not a stove). No couch or separate room. It is false advertising to call it a suite.
reviews.title: " Good Budget Motel "

reviews.text: I booked at this hotel due to the convenient location and easy in and out of the freeway. I was happy about the pool and spa area. Just what I needed after a long day on the road with a Uhaul. I enjoyed the pool while my wife sat in the Steam Room- which is quite unique for an Econo Lodge. The breakfast had the neccessitys for the road trip ahead- cereal, toast, and waffles. Overall the hotel had the services and gave good directions to get me back on the road. I will stop by for sure on my way back through Flagstaff.
reviews.title: Simple....and great!

reviews.text: We went to the so called breakfast after a night in a room that looked like something out of the Bates Motel. There was food all over the place waffle batter and dirty cups were scattered about the room. When I went to complain to the front desk she told me "its not their job to clean they were not a restaurant" After realizing this woman had a major chip on her shoulder I went to the room to clean up and have breakfast else where. The shower did not work, the blow dryer was faulty and I had it - So I went to ask for a modest refund of 18.00 price of the breakfast - the HoJO with no breakfast was charging 50.00 for a room without breakfast. The woman snarled at me and said " Oh you were the one who was drinking waffle batter" - yikes (crazy lady) and yelled at me to leave. I put the keys on the desk and she promptly threw them back at me. She then picked up a stapler and threatened to throw it at me. I left and called the police and in the red neck town of Flagstaff the police said he was not there to break up "cat fights". WOW! I spoke to the manager, Clarion and no one seemed to care there was a crazy woman at the desk wilding staplers.
reviews.title: Hotel Hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Need less to say - I will never go to a Clarion hotel or Flagstaff again.
reviews.title: You get what you paid for!!!!

likes.disliked: — Awful customer service and attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was in a well situated location with nearby hotels, highways and restaurants making it easy to access. However, the quality of the hotel was very poor. The rooms were small, the bathroom tiny, the tv modest and the bed aged as if it had been there for some time. Additionally, we asked the cleaning staff to clean our room an hour after they knocked at 9am and they never returned which prompted us when we arrived from a full day of activities to complain and ask for the room to be cleaned. Our response from the night staff was that they had no cleaning staff at 10pm and that they had no rooms available to accommodate us. Our response was very clear, stern and unaccepting which prompted a reply that they would move us to an adjacent room. The lack of accommodation after such a case and the manner in which night staff treated their guests, led me to believe that this hotel does not support it staff and they in turn do not care for their clients. In the end, we did obtain a change of room but to audaciously lie about not having rooms on a Sunday night when the hotel was empty was wrong and moreover left me with a bad taste. The mornings were interesting because they confirmed full continental breakfast before 10:30am but if you arrived after 9:30am they had already put away most of the food.
reviews.title: a miss this time
Disgruntled in Flagstaff
reviews.text: I would say that although this was not the worst hotel I have stayed at, it was definately one of the bottom 10. Anyway, I can't complain too much given the price that they charge and the fact that they really cater to the students and families of those attending the local university in the area who often are looking for a bargain place to stay overnight during their visits with their kids. To enhance this option, they even had a laundry room for those who were residing there for more than a few days - very typical of my long past university days.

reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever
reviews.text: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Employees are down right rude, and the rooms are the dirtiest and plain unsafe. The toilet seat was broken, exposed wires hung down from one of the lamps, three different colored sheets, beds as hard as the floor, swimming pool and jacuzzi you can't even see the bottom of, and a "breakfast" a homeless person would turn down. If you value your family and your money don't ever stay at an Econo Lodge

reviews.title: Not Lucky on Lucky Lane
reviews.text: Visited Flaggstaff and acquired this hotel through . The hotel staff charged us again at check-in, and the rooms were a nightmare. Lights were burned out in our room and it looked as if someone had stayed in our room the night before without having the sheets changed! The room had remnants of a previous guest. Carpets looked as if they hadn't been vacuumed in a while. Bathrooms needed a good wipe down. Every sheet and pillow case had been marked up with permanent marker, stating they were property of Econo Lodge, and also had a number on them. Everything from the channel changer to the coffee pot were either missing pieces or broken. Breakfast consisted of stale cereal, spoiled milk, watered down juice, waffles and coffee.

Great ammenities for the price and only a mile from downtown. It's just out of range of the train noise and very clean and quiet. Amenities include hot continental breakfast, full cable TV with HBO, pool, spa, sauna, small exercise room and even a steam room! There are coin operated laundry on two floors for the guests. They even give Southwest rewards points. A National/Alamo rental office is only a 5 minute walk away at the nearby Holiday Inn. It's not like a plush Vegas hotel, but more than adequate for the weary traveler or Flagstaff visitor. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Incredible Value

description: This hotel is situated in Flagstaff, Arizona, only minutes from motorway I-40. Guests can experience this comfortable accommodation located a short distance from many of the area's top attractions.The Econo Lodge Flagstaff provides guests with easy access to explore much of the surrounding areas. The Navajo and Hopi Indian Reservations, the Painted Desert and the Petrified Forest are only a short drive away.We have 3 eating places: Denny's, Cracker Barrel, and Outback Steak House, in a 5 minute walking distance and a Super Walmart is located just a few hundred yards down Lucky Lane. Our all-year-open heated pool, hot tub, wet steam room, and dry sauna are all conveniently located on the first floor. Also, the work out room (treadmill and recumbent bike) overlooks the pool so that you can watch your kids swim while working out. Come stop by our hotel and ask to see one of the rooms. We will be happy to show you our cheapest single queen room to our larger, nicer King Suites.
